data.title: Municipal leads and Panamanian Arroyo excels in football tournament in Peru
data.meta_description: Municipal leads and Panamanian Arroyo excels in football tournament in Peru
data.text: Lima, 21 Mar Deportivo Municipal resumed the lead in the Peruvian Liga 1 Apertura Tournament, at the end of matchday seven of the competition, which will go into recess until next April 1 due to the dispute of the last two days of the qualifiers for the Qatar 2022 World Cup. The Academy tied 1-1 with Atlético Grau and reached 16 points, one more than Alianza Atlético, which lost 3-1 on their visit to Cesar Vallejo, in a match in which Panamanian striker Abdiel Arroyo, who scored two scores, shined. Municipal reached 16 points, one more than Atlético, after taking the lead on the scoreboard with a goal by Adrián Ascues, who was then paired by Arly Benitez. These are other highlights that the day left: TWO GOALS BY ARROYO Atlético, who came from a few days at full speed, stumbled against Vallejo, who took away the undefeated in the tournament and left him parked in second place, with 15 units. Panamanian Arroyo opened the account 9 minutes into the game and increased the gap to 51, while national Osnar Noronha closed the figures for Vallejo at 82. Atlético won the discount in the minutes of addition through striker Joyce Conde. CIENCIANO THRASHED Cienciano sealed, for his part, the biggest win of the date, by beating Sport Boys 4-1, who added a hard blow after being eliminated in the middle of the week from the Copa Sudamericana by Ayacucho. In the Cusco team, Argentine striker Danilo Carando stood out, who also scored two goals after entering the second half, which were added to those won in the first half by nationals Kevin Sandoval and Adrián Ugarriza. The Boys achieved the score of honor in the 90 minutes of the game, through Jostin Alarcón. THE ARGENTINIAN CUESTA HIGHLIGHTS Argentine gunner Bernardo Cuesta once again showed his scoring nose to score at the end of the first half the lone goal with which Melgar defeated the late Cantolao, from Lima's Callao port, 0-1. While ADT and Ayacucho were left in the draw and without opening the score, Sporting Cristal rescued a point in their visit to Carlos Stein, thanks to the 1-1 that they achieved with a half-point goal Alejandro Hohberg, after their rival took the lead on the scoreboard with a score by Uruguayan striker Gabriel Leyes. The Universitario de Deportes, led by Uruguayan Alvaro Gutiérrez, continued to fail to raise his head and lost by 0-1 on his visit to Binacional, with an own-goal by defender Nelinho Quina at the end of the first half. HUANCAYO SEALS A GREAT VICTORY Matchday seven was closed on Monday with Sport Huancayo's big 3-4 win over UTC, with all the goals won in the second half of the match played in Cajamarca. For Huancayo, Chilean Carlos Ross, Hugo Ángeles, Luis Benites and Colombia's Victor Perlaza scored, while those of the homeowner were Uruguayan Facundo Peraza and national Hideyoshi Arakaki, while Angel Pérez scored in his own goal. In the last match of the day, Carlos Mannucci defeated San Martín 1-3, with two goals from national creative Yuriel Celi and another by striker Javier Nuñez, and the discount from Ecuadorian Joffre Escobar. Alianza Lima, the current champion of national football, had a rest date.
